standard_metadata.standard_description: Understand a multiple of a/b as a multiple of 1/b, and use this understanding to multiply a fraction by a whole number.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Multiply fractions and whole numbers on the number line

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-halves to six-halves with labeled tick marks at every one-half unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-halves to one-half, from one-half to two-halves, from two-halves to three-halves, from three-halves to four-halves, and then from four-halves to five-halves.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac12$ on the number line $\greenD5$ times to get to the point.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-halves to six-halves with labeled tick marks at every one-half unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-halves to one-half, from one-half to two-halves, from two-halves to three-halves, from three-halves to four-halves, from four-halves to five-halves. Beneath the first jump is the label 1. Beneath the second jump is the label 2. Beneath the third jump is the label 3. Beneath the fourth jump is the label 4. Beneath the fifth jump is the label 5.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac12+\dfrac12+\dfrac12+\dfrac12+\dfrac12$ .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\greenD5 \times \dfrac12$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac12+\dfrac12+\dfrac12+\dfrac12+\dfrac12$  * $5 \times \dfrac12$

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-halves to six-halves with labeled tick marks at every one-half unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-halves to one-half, from one-half to two-halves, and then from two-halves to three-halves.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac12$ on the number line $\greenD3$ times to get to the point.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-halves to six-halves with labeled tick marks at every one-half unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-halves to one-half, from one-half to two-halves, and then from two-halves to three-halves.  Beneath the first jump is the label 1. Beneath the second jump is the label 2. Beneath the third jump is the label 3.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac{1}{2}+\dfrac{1}{2} + \dfrac{1}{2}$ .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\greenD3 \times \dfrac12$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac{1}{2}+\dfrac{1}{2} + \dfrac{1}{2}$  * $3 \times \dfrac12$

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-twelfths to eight-twelfths with labeled tick marks at every one-twelfth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-twelfths to one-twelfth, from one-twelfth to two-twelfths, from two-twelfths to three-twelfths, from three-twelfths to four-twelfths, and then from four-twelfths to five-twelfths.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac{1}{12}$ on the number line $\greenD5$ times to get to the point.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-twelfths to eight-twelfths with labeled tick marks at every one-twelfth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-twelfths to one-twelfth, from one-twelfth to two-twelfths, from two-twelfths to three-twelfths, from three-twelfths to four-twelfths, and then from four-twelfths to five-twelfths. Beneath the first jump is the label 1. Beneath the second jump is the label 2. Beneath the third jump is the label 3. Beneath the fourth jump is the label 4. Beneath the fifth jump is the label 5.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac{1}{12}+\dfrac{1}{12} + \dfrac{1}{12} + \dfrac{1}{12}+ \dfrac{1}{12}$ .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\greenD5 \times \dfrac{1}{12}$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac{1}{12}+\dfrac{1}{12} + \dfrac{1}{12} + \dfrac{1}{12}+ \dfrac{1}{12}$  * $5 \times \dfrac{1}{12}$

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-tenths to ten-tenths with labeled tick marks at every one-tenth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-tenths to three-tenths, from three-tenths to six-tenths, and then from six-tenths to nine-tenths.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac{3}{10}$ on the number line $\greenD3$ times to get to the point.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-tenths to ten-tenths with labeled tick marks at every one-tenth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-tenths to three-tenths, from three-tenths to six-tenths, and then from six-tenths to nine-tenths. Beneath the first jump is the label 1. Beneath the second jump is the label 2. Beneath the third jump is the label 3.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac{3}{10}+\dfrac{3}{10}+\dfrac{3}{10}$  .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\greenD3 \times \dfrac{3}{10}$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac{3}{10}+\dfrac{3}{10}+\dfrac{3}{10}$  * $3 \times \dfrac{3}{10}$

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-halves to eight-halves with labeled tick marks at every one-half unit. A green arrow jumps right from zero-halves to three-halves and then from three-halves to six-halves.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac32$ on the number line $\greenD2$ times to get to the point.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-halves to eight-halves with labeled tick marks at every one-half unit. A green arrow jumps right from zero-halves to three-halves and is labeled 1. The arrow then jumps from three-halves to six-halves and is labeled 2.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac{3}{2}+\dfrac{3}{2}$  .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\greenD2 \times\dfrac{3}{2}$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac{3}{2}+\dfrac{3}{2}$   * $2 \times \dfrac32$

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-fourths to eleven-fourths with labeled tick marks at every one-fourth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-fourths to five-fourths and then from five-fourths to ten-fourths.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac54$ on the number line $\greenD2$ times to get to the point.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-fourths to eleven-fourths with labeled tick marks at every one-fourth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-fourths to five-fourths and then from five-fourths to ten-fourths. Beneath the first jump is the label 1. Beneath the second jump is the label 2.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac{5}{4}+\dfrac{5}{4}$  .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\greenD2 \times \dfrac54$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac{5}{4}+\dfrac{5}{4}$  * $2 \times \dfrac54$

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-eighths to eight-eighths with labeled tick marks at every one-eighth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-eighths to three-eighths and then from three-eighths to six-eighths.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac38$ on the number line $\greenD2$ times to get to the point.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-eighths to eight-eighths with labeled tick marks at every one-eighth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-eighths to three-eighths and then from three-eighths to six-eighths. Beneath the first jump is the label 1. Beneath the second jump is the label 2.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac{3}{8}+\dfrac{3}{8}$  .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\greenD2 \times \dfrac38$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac{3}{8}+\dfrac{3}{8}$    * $2 \times \dfrac38$

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-thirds to eight-thirds with labeled tick marks at every one-third unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-thirds to two-thirds, from two-thirds to four-thirds, and then from four-thirds to six-thirds.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac23$ on the number line $\greenD3$ times to get to the point.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-thirds to eight-thirds with labeled tick marks at every one-third unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-thirds to two-thirds, from two-thirds to four-thirds, and then from four-thirds to six-thirds. Beneath the first jump is the label 1. Beneath the second jump is the label 2. Beneath the third jump is the label 3.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac23 + \dfrac23 +\dfrac23$  .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\dfrac23 \times \greenD3$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac23 + \dfrac23 +\dfrac23$  * $\dfrac23 \times \greenD3$

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-fourths to eight-fourths with labeled tick marks at every one-fourth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-fourths to two-fourths, from two-fourths to four-fourths, and then from four-fourths to six-fourths.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac24$ on the number line $\greenD3$ times to get to the point.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-fourths to eight-fourths with labeled tick marks at every one-fourth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-fourths to two-fourths, from two-fourths to four-fourths, and then from four-fourths to six-fourths. Beneath the first jump is the label 1. Beneath the second jump is the label 2. Beneath the third jump is the label 3.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac24 + \dfrac24 +\dfrac24$  .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\dfrac24 \times \greenD3$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac24 + \dfrac24 +\dfrac24$  * $\dfrac24 \times \greenD3$

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-fifths to eight-fifths with labeled tick marks at every one-fifth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-fifths to two-fifths, from two-fifths to four-fifths, from four-fifths to six-fifths, and then from six-fifths to eight-fifths.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac25$ on the number line $\greenD4$ times to get to the point.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-fifths to eight-fifths with labeled tick marks at every one-fifth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-fifths to two-fifths, from two-fifths to four-fifths, from four-fifths to six-fifths, and then from six-fifths to eight-fifths. Beneath the first jump is the label 1. Beneath the second jump is the label 2. Beneath the third jump is the label 3. Beneath the fourth jump is the label 4.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac25 + \dfrac25 + \dfrac25 + \dfrac25$  .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\dfrac25 \times \greenD4$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac25 + \dfrac25 + \dfrac25 + \dfrac25$  .  * $\dfrac25 \times \greenD4$

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-sixths to eight-sixths with labeled tick marks at every one-sixth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-sixths to one-sixth, then from one-sixth to two-sixths, then from two-sixths to three-sixths. then from three-sixths to four-sixths, then from four-sixths to five-sixths, and then five-sixths to six-sixths.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac16$ on the number line $\greenD6$ times to get to the point.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-sixths to eight-sixths with labeled tick marks at every one-sixth unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-sixths to one-sixth, then from one-sixth to two-sixths, then from two-sixths to three-sixths. then from three-sixths to four-sixths, then from four-sixths to five-sixths, and then five-sixths to six-sixths. Beneath the first jump is the label 1. Beneath the second jump is the label 2. Beneath the third jump is the label 3. Beneath the fourth jump is the label 4. Beneath the fifth jump is the label 5. Beneath the sixth jump is the label 6.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac16+ \dfrac16 + \dfrac16+ \dfrac16 + \dfrac16+ \dfrac16$  .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\dfrac16 \times \greenD6$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac16+ \dfrac16 + \dfrac16+ \dfrac16 + \dfrac16+ \dfrac16$   * $\dfrac16 \times \greenD6$

question.content: **Which expressions match the following number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-thirds to eight-thirds with labeled tick marks at every one-third unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-thirds to one-third, from one-third to two-thirds, from two-thirds to three-thirds, from three-thirds to four-thirds, and then from four-thirds to five-thirds.

hints.content: Starting from $0$, the arrow moves a length of $\dfrac13$ on the number line $\greenD5$ times to get to the point.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-thirds to eight-thirds with labeled tick marks at every one-third unit. A green arrow jumps left to right from zero-thirds to one-third, from one-third to two-thirds, from two-thirds to three-thirds, from three-thirds to four-thirds, and then from four-thirds to five-thirds.  Beneath the first jump is the label 1. Beneath the second jump is the label 2. Beneath the third jump is the label 3. Beneath the fourth jump is the label 4. Beneath the fifth jump is the label 5.

hints.content: We can express this movement by adding $\dfrac13+ \dfrac13 + \dfrac13+ \dfrac13 + \dfrac13$  .
We can also express this movement by multiplying $\dfrac13 \times \greenD5$  .
The following expressions match the number line:  * $\dfrac13+ \dfrac13 + \dfrac13+ \dfrac13 + \dfrac13$  * $\dfrac13 \times \greenD5$
